item.title: Apple signs the White House’s commitment to AI safety
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Apple joins 15 other tech companies — including Google, Meta, Microsoft and OpenAI — that committed to the White House's rules for developing generative AI.

item.title: Privacy watchdog says it’s ‘surprised’ by Elon Musk opting user data into Grok AI training
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
The language is ambiguous, so it's not clear whether X is helping itself to all user data for training Grok or whether this processing refers only to user interactions with the chatbot.

item.title: TikTok rolls out a new feature that lets you find songs by singing or humming them
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Sound Search on TikTok is somewhat similar to YouTube Music’s song detection tool that lets you find the name of a song by singing, humming or playing it. 

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Alphabet X spinoff Skip partners with Arc’teryx to bring ‘everyday’ exoskeleton to market
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Skip exited stealth this week to announce a partnership with outdoor clothing specialist Arc’teryx. The deal is the first to bring Skip’s MO/GO technology to market: “powered pants” that utilize a soft exoskeleton technology, developed in-house at Alphabet’s X Labs moonshot factory. MO/GO, short for “mountain goat,” is a hybrid soft/rigid exoskeleton system designed to […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Microsoft brings more generative AI to Bing
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Bing is the latest search engine to introduce generative AI into its results, with Microsoft announcing that it’s making Bing generative search available to a small percentage of users. The goal is to give those users the answers they want right in their search results, potentially synthesizing information that they’d otherwise have to click through […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Ledger launches Ledger Flex, a mid-range hardware crypto wallet
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Ledger, a French startup mostly known for its secure crypto hardware wallets, has launched a new mid-range device, the Ledger Flex. Available now, priced at $249, the dinky hardware wallet features an E-Ink display to navigate the interface and approve transactions with a tap. Like all of Ledger’s wallets, the Ledger Flex is built around […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Here’s how to disable X (Twitter) from using your data to train its Grok AI
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
The good news is that you can switch off the new data-sharing setting and also delete your conversation history with the AI. 

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: SpaceX cleared to resume Falcon 9 launches while FAA investigation remains open
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Regulators gave SpaceX the all-clear to return to launch two weeks after the Falcon 9 rocket experienced an anomaly on orbit.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Digital marketing startup Plaiced has acquired Precursor Ventures-backed Clutch
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Madison Long and Simone May founded Clutch in 2020 to help connect people to businesses looking for marketing and content creation.

item.title: ZeroTier raises $13.5M to help avert CrowdStrike-like network problems
item.dc:creator: Mike Butcher
item.description:
With the CrowdStrike update continuing to cause havoc across the planet, a startup has raised $13.5 million to at least improve some level of security for the kinds of devices that have been affected. California-based ZeroTier raised the Series A in a funding round led by Battery Ventures. While legacy companies like Cisco or Palo […]

item.title: Apple cuts iPhone price in India amid China slowdown
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Apple has reduced prices of its iPhone models in India by 3-4% following a cut in import duties in the South Asian market.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Egypt’s MNT-Halan banks $157.5M, gobbles up a fintech in Turkey to expand
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description:
MNT-Halan, a fintech unicorn out of Egypt, is on a consolidation march. The microfinance and payments startup has raised $157.5 million in funding and is using the money in part to fund the acquisition of another fintech, Tam Finans, to expand into Turkey. Tam Finans provides financing to micro-enterprises and SMEs. It currently operates 39 […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Energy tech startup Greenely grabs €8M to reach more households and support Europe’s energy transition
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
The energy transition is a marathon, not a sprint. But opportunities for acceleration are growing. Swedish startup Greenely* has just spotted one. It’s closing an €8 million Series A funding round to expand its energy management platform into neighbouring Nordic countries (so around $8.7M at current exchange rates). The energy tech startup is serving around […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Luxury fashion startup The Floorr empowers personal stylists with tools to grow their businesses
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
The Floorr offers tools for conducting sales, hosting tailored styling sessions, creating mood boards, and engaging in text or voice chats with clients, all in one place. 

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Here’s why David Sacks, Paul Graham and other big Silicon Valley names had a brawl on X over VC behavior
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description:
A decade-old drama involving VC David Sacks and Rippling founder Parker Conrad has blown up on X with many among the Silicon Valley elite taking sides.

item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022. What started as a tool to hyper-charge productivity through writing essays and code with short text prompts has evolved into a behemoth used by more than 92% of Fortune 500 companies. That growth has propelled OpenAI itself into […]

item.title: Applied Intuition closes $300M secondary four months after raising $250M
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Autonomous vehicle software startup Applied Intuition has closed a $300 million secondary sale just four months after raising a $250 million Series E round, yet another sign of how white-hot the investment scene is for artificial intelligence companies. The secondary round adds Fidelity Management & Research Company to an already-stacked lineup of investors in the […]

item.title: With Google in its sights, OpenAI unveils SearchGPT
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI may have designs to get into the search game — challenging not only upstarts like Perplexity, but Google and Bing, too. The company on Thursday unveiled SearchGPT, a search feature designed to give “timely answers” to questions, drawing from web sources. UI-wise, SearchGPT isn’t too far off from OpenAI’s chatbot platform ChatGPT. You type […]

item.title: Uber, Lyft, DoorDash can continue to classify drivers as contractors in California
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
The California Supreme Court ruled Thursday that Proposition 22 — the ballot measure that passed in November 2020 and classified app-based gig workers as independent contractors rather than employees — is here to stay.  The decision is a win for app-based companies like Uber, Lyft, DoorDash and Instacart, which have fought hard to maintain their […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says WhatsApp has 100M monthly active users in the US
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
WhatsApp has recently ramped up its marketing push in the U.S.
